div.p: There is some basic training you need when working in hospitality, it depends what side of hospitality you’re working in if you’re working in the kitchens
there’s a Kitchen Hygiene course which I’ve done; I’ve done a basic First Aid course with St John’s Ambulance and I used to work in retail
I had a friend in retail who pushed me very heavily to go and get some qualifications to push me into a further chance of job prospects in the future
I thought college would be absolutely crap and I couldn’t be bothered going back to basics and learning basic English and Maths
when I thought I could do it all... Actually there was a lot I didn’t know and now I’ve got the piece of paper it’s helped me a lot. The hardest part
was writing out the assessment forms, that was the hardest thing for me and I had to get help from my step sister who is a lot better with English than me.
To be able to learn something I hadn’t learned before and to get a certificate at the end for me the certificate is everything.
